s.text: "Eppie" (not her real name) used to write an advice column.
I trace my lineage back to Joseph, Solomon, the Delphic Oracle, Cassandra, Adam Smith, and Benjamin Franklin.
I'm sure a person as clever as you can find many questions that meet the standard you have read into our instructions.
Readers would write her with their questions on life, love, and (usually) microeconomics, and she would give them really great advice, e.g., "Wake up and smell the coffee, honey!"
I contend that the only way one person should kiss off another is face to face.

I contend that the only way one person should kiss off another is face to face.
In recent years, one of my favorite newspaper columnists has become less and less interesting.

It would indeed be rude, unless you called first and asked whether it would be OK.
